body_html:
I am wondering the exact use case you are trying to address, as we already have randomised hashing in sklearn (here and there).

Or you would like to implement this in C/C++ and export the symbol to bindings of other languages?
body_text:
I am wondering the exact use case you are trying to address, as we already have randomised hashing in sklearn (here and there).
Or you would like to implement this in C/C++ and export the symbol to bindings of other languages?
body:
I am wondering the exact use case you are trying to address, as we already have randomised hashing in `sklearn` ([here](http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.feature_extraction.FeatureHasher.html) and [there](http://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.feature_extraction.text.HashingVectorizer.html)).

Or you would like to implement this in C/C++ and export the symbol to bindings of other languages?
